content:
Hi all, I just wanted to say hi. I'm Luciano a Devops/SRE from London (although I was born in Uruguay).
I got in touch with @Pietro Albini on Twitter because I am interested in help the infra team.
Just so you have a little bit more of background about me: I been doing DevOps for the last 5 years, in the last two I worked as SRE at Disney Streaming Services (the company behind Disney+, ESPN+, HULU) and now I'm at a consulting company working as architect for Cloud, Devops and Security
So I am interested in infrastructure in general, cloud, automation, IaaC, programming.
:wave:
as I mentioned before, contributing to our cloud infra is currently a bit tricky, as a lot of the stuff is not on terraform yet
but there are a lot of other infra projects that need some love, even though they're a bit more on the coding side
Would love to hear more about those other infra projects I can help with :blush:
docs.rs always needs help
https://github.com/rust-lang/docs.rs/issues/1176 is a good first issue
@Luciano Facchinelli I'm wondering, which OS are you using? and which programming languages are you the most comfortable with? :)

MacOS at the moment
Go, Python, Rust
ok, so, there would be a project that would have a huge impact on Rust users on macOS but that we don't have the time to implement right now
basically, rust and rustup releases at the moment are neither codesigned nor notarized, and that's becoming more and more of a problem as apple continues to push for everything to be signed

we have rough plans for either me or @simulacrum to start tackling that next year, but if you're interested in working on the tooling to codesign and notarize stuff we could ship that to users earlier :D
(we can't deploy it right now as we don't have an apple developer account currently, but that's something the foundation will surely get)
how does that sound?
(if you'd prefer to help with something else there are other ideas too!)

Sure, I'd love to help on that!
Is there any doc/information available about what you guys have done so far that I can start reading to catch up?
so, unfortunately there is not a bunch of documentation
I could either write something down in an issue/document, or setup a call to chat with you on this
Whatever works for you, both options work for me
The first one might be beneficial for others in the team
I'd need more information about how rustup/rust release pipeline works as well, to fully understand how to add this codesign step into them
wrote a small summary of the problem on this issue: https://github.com/rust-lang/promote-release/issues/34
I'd love thoughts or followup questions
@Pietro Albini added some comments to the PR
@Luciano Facchinelli I'm wondering if you'd be up to have a zoom call soonish
I feel like that's going to be way faster than discussing on github :)
Sure, next week I'll be available pretty much throughout the week
:tada:
next monday?
Next Monday sounds good . Morning/Afternoon/Evening?
afternoon CET works for me any time
16 cet/15 gmt?
15 cet/14 gmt?
also works!
if you PM me the email address I'll send an invite
Will do
ok sent an invite!
also added @simulacrum as optional if they can make the time
